abstract: Recordings made by the Federal Bureau of Investigation provide a glimpse into the shadowy, and illegal, world of high-stakes gambling in New York City; recordings, according to court papers, were made over the last two years during an investigation into what federal prosecutors in Manhattan have characterized as two related multimillion-dollar money-laundering and gambling rings.
lead_paragraph: Recordings made over the last two years provide a glimpse into the shadowy, and illegal, world of high-stakes gambling in New York City.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM, JAMES GLANZ and RANDY KENNEDY

headline.main: 5th Ave. Poker, With $25,000 Chips and an F.B.I. Ace in the Hole
headline.print_headline: 5th Ave. Poker, With $25,000 Chips and an F.B.I. Ace in the Hole
headline.seo: F.B.I. Tapes Give Glimpse Into World of High-Stakes Gambling

snippet: Recordings made over the last two years provide a glimpse into the shadowy, and illegal, world of high-stakes gambling in New York City....
